text: The Groupement des écoles d'aéronautique (GEA France) (in English French aviation school network) includes three French engineering universities: L'aéronautique forme des cadets en Chine et en Libye * École nationale de l'aviation civile (ÉNAC), Aix-en-Provence, Carcassonne, Castelnaudary, Toulouse, Muret, Montpellier, Grenoble, Biscarosse, Château-Arnoux-Saint- Auban, Saint-Yan et Melun, * École nationale supérieure de mécanique et d'aérotechnique (ISAE-ENSMA), Poitiers, * Institut supérieur de l'aéronautique et de l'espace (ISAE), Toulouse. The GEA is member of the Conference of European Schools for Advanced Engineering Education and Research. == Project == The GEA universities have created the Institut sino-européen d'ingénierie de l'aviation of Tianjin Signature d’une convention de partenariat entre l’AEFE et le Groupe des Ecoles d’Aéronautique (GEA) in partnership with French aerospace companies. SAFRAN, PARTENAIRE DES UNIVERSITÉS CHINOISES This is part of Franco-Chinese cooperation after an Airbus A320 assembly plant was built in Tianjin. Les formations en partenariat The university, opened in October 2007, trains Chinese students. They follow a course in aerospace engineering, taught in French. After a first year of learning the French language, they follow a master's degree course in aeronautical engineering. Not linked with the engineering training, three Mastères Spécialisés are also taught in Tianjin: Mastères spécialisés == References == Category:Aerospace engineering Category:Aviation in France Category:French Civil Aviation University Category:Engineering schools
title: Groupement des écoles d'aéronautique
